channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3666] Ecologically Efficient Square Coke Bottle design
item.description: Stackable, crushable (for recycling), requires less footprint than round bottles. What a great idea. Hopefully this concept catches on.

item.title: [+2857] Little Chatroulette Bastard
item.description: If this is this real kid he's going to be a bastard when he's older, he's trolling at 8!

item.title: [+2578] Goldeneye (PIC)
[+2145] The War On WikiLeaks And Why It Matters
item.description: The U.S. government escalates its campaign to harass and destroy a key whistle blowing site.

item.title: [+1698] English Drunks in early 1900s (mug shots)
item.description: Angry, bewildered and shame-faced these Edwardian drunks stare into the lens of the police camera.

item.title: [+1588] FACT CHECK: GOP Lying About Health Care Reform & Military
item.description: FACT CHECK: Health Care Reform Will Not Move Military Health Care ‘To The Department That Handles Welfare’.

item.title: [+1309] Dear Texas: Please shut up. Sincerely, History
item.description: Despite what you may have heard from the liberal media, America has very much won its recent, God-sanctioned wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Angry Allah loses again!

item.title: [+1238] New PlayStation 3 Update Removes Linux Support
item.description: Firmware disables "Install Other OS" system feature available in all pre-slim models.

item.title: [+1123] Van Gogh Cake
[+1105] Condition 1 Weather in Antarctica [VIDEO]
item.description: During Condition 1 Weather in Antarctica, you are not allowed to go outside. Not that you would want to, as you can see in this video when a door to the outside is opened up.

item.title: [+1072] 'Battlefield Earth' Screenwriter: "Sorry About That!"
item.description: J.D. Shapiro wrote one of the most derided films of all time. Now, he's saying sorry. In early March, 2000's 'Battlefield Earth' was "awarded" worst movie of the decade by the Razzies. But Shapiro knows what he did was awful. Truly awful, and in an open letter published by the NY Post, he hilariously tries to explain himself.

item.title: [+1055] Blast in Moscow metro kills 25:
item.description: At least 25 people were killed in an explosion that rocked the Lubyanka metro station in central Moscow on Monday, Itar-Tass news agency reported.At least 10 people were wounded in the blast, it said, quoting the Emergencies Ministry.

item.title: [+854] Ricky Martin Admits to Being Gay
item.description: After years of speculation, Puerto Rican pop star Ricky Martin has come out of the closet.

item.title: [+770] xkcd: Recipes
[+738] 15 of the Trashiest People to Ever Become Famous
item.description: Despite their acting or singing talents which brought them the spotlight to begin with, celebrities' personalities don't always shine so bright.

item.title: [+707] Indiana Threatened By Giant Poop Bubbles
item.description: Mr. Goltstein asked state regulators to let him pop the poop bubbles. He said he and his 19-year-old son would slice them open with a knife from a paddleboat.

item.title: [+685] 6 Things Men Do To Get Laid That Science Says Turn Women Off
item.description: Your very existence completely mortifies women.

item.title: [+643] The Truth About Cell Phones & Airplanes (Infographic)
item.description: We can all agree that it is annoying to have to turn your phone off when you board a plane, but do you know why you have to do it?

item.title: [+625] Obama 2.0: Now with 30% More Partisanship
item.description: Circumventing the Senate confirmation process, President Obama has installed 15 appointees while Congress is out on spring recess. Pundits are spinning it as a sign of Obama's renewed willingness to defy Republican obstructionism. Is this a new phase of the Obama presidency?

item.title: [+619] How is Prince the normal one? (chart)
item.description: A comparative breakdown of six pop princes.
